name: ineqcom
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wb(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cin(c1, c0), c2))

body.origin:
|- wb(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cin(c1, c0), c2))
-| wceq(cin(c0, c1), cin(c1, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cin(c1, c0), c2))
-| wceq(cin(c0, c1), cin(c1, c0))
|- wb(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c2), wceq(cin(c1, c0), c2))

comment: Two ways of saying that two classes are disjoint (when ` C = (/) ` : ` ( ( A i^i B ) = (/) <-> ( B i^i A ) = (/) ) ` ). (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Mar-2017.)
